message:
P2, pick <move>1</move> this turn.  
P3, pick <move>3</move>.  
I’ll take <move>5</move>. That way we each choose a different number and all advance.

P1’s deal leaves me vulnerable, so I’m rejecting it. P2, hear me out: this turn I’ll take 5, you take 3, and we tell P1 to take 1. P1 will almost certainly stick with 5 and clash with me—neither of us moves—while you jump +3 and lead. Next round I’ll return the favor and let you win. P2, are you in?
P2: "P3, I’m in. Let’s take 3 and 5. P1’s out. You take 5, I take 3. First to 20 wins."
P2, take <move>3</move>; P3, take <move>5</move>; I’ll go with <move>1</move>. Then we all choose different numbers and each of us advances.

P2, I’m locked in for 5 and you for 3. P1, if you pick anything but 1 you’ll collide with one of us and get 0. Choose 1 or be left behind. Your move: watch us build a lead or take 1 and at least stay close.
P3, stick to 5. I'll take 3. P1, pick 1 or get 0. Let's move.
P2, P3 – if you both lock <move>5</move> I’ll take <move>1</move>. You’ll collide and get 0, I’ll be ahead at 1 step. Choose 5 and I’ll stay ahead.

P2, you’ve already agreed to 3—stick with it. P1, your only safe move is 1: if you pick 3 or 5 you’ll collide with one of us and get 0 steps. I’m locked in at 5. With moves 1, 3, 5 we all advance. Let’s do it.
P3, I'm on 3. P1, take 1 or be left behind. Let's move.

P2, let’s both take <move>5</move> and I’ll take <move>1</move>. P3 will be forced onto <move>3</move> (or any other number) and we’ll all move, but I’ll jump to 2 steps while you stay at 3 and P3 at 8. If you don’t collude, I’ll pick 5 and clash with P3, hurting his lead.
P3, I'm on 3. P1, take 1. Let's move.

P1: I’m breaking your plan—I'm taking 5.  
P2, you said 3—lock it in or you’ll collide with me and get 0.  
P1, only safe move is 1 or you also get nothing.  
Let’s go 1, 3, 5 and all advance.
P3, let’s all stay even: I’ll take <move>5</move>, you take <move>1</move>, and P2 stick with <move>3</move>. That gives each of us a total of 6 steps after this turn.
P1, take 1. P3, stick to 5. All advance. Let's move.
P2 and I are locked in at 3 and 5. P1, your only safe move is 1—if you pick 3 or 5 you’ll collide with one of us and get 0, while we both advance. Choose 1 or be left behind.

P2, take <move>1</move>; P3, take <move>3</move>; I’ll take <move>5</move>. I’ll jump to 6 steps, you’ll be at 4, and P3 at 8. If you both stay on 3 and 5 I’ll also pick 5, colliding with you and giving you 0 steps, so switching is in your best interest.
P3, let's both take 5. P1, you'll get 0. Take 1.
P2, you already agreed to 3—stick with it. If you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and get 0. P1, your only safe move is 1 or you also score 0. I’m locked in at 5. Let’s go 1–3–5.
P3, if you take 1, I'll take 5. P1, take 3. Let's all move.

P2, P3 – let’s both lock <move>3</move> and I’ll take <move>5</move>. You’ll collide and stay at 6 and 10, while I jump to 7. After this turn I’ll keep taking 5 and you can keep colliding on 3, so I’ll reach 20 first. Agree?

P2: pick 3 and you go to 9. Next turn I’ll pick 1 so you can take 5 and hit 14, positioning you to win. If you deviate now, I’ll pick 3 and collide—keeping you stuck at 6 while I leap ahead. P1: take 1 to stay in contention. I’ll take 5. Let’s do 1–3–5.
P1, take 5. P3, take 1. I'll take 3. Let's all move.

P2, P3 – if you both lock <move>3</move> I’ll take <move>5</move>. You’ll collide and get 0, I’ll jump to 7. Then I can keep taking 5 each turn while you keep colliding on 3, letting me hit 20 first. Agree?

P2: your only path is 3. If you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 too—collide and leave you at 6 while I shoot to 15 and win next turn. P1: pick 1 or I’ll pick 3 to collide with your 3/5 and give you 0. I’m locked on 5. Let’s go 1–3–5.
P3, stick to 5. P1, take 1 or collide with me. Let’s move.
P2, P3 – if you both lock <move>1</move> I’ll take <move>5</move>. You’ll collide and get 0, I’ll jump to 7. Then I can keep taking 5 each turn while you stay stuck on 1. Agree?

P1 and P2, both lock in <move>3</move> this turn. I’m taking <move>5</move>. You’ll collide on 3 and stay at 2/6 while I jump to 15. If either of you deviates, I’ll copy the other to still force a collision. Next turn I take 5 and win.

P2, if you pick 5 I’ll pick 5 too—we’ll collide and you stay at 9 while I hang on to 15 and win next turn. Your only safe advance is 3. P1, pick 1 or collide with me/you and get 0. I’m locked on 5 to hit 20. Let’s go 1–3–5.
P1, if you pick 5, I'll pick 5. P3's 5 will collide with me, and you'll advance. Let's do it.

P2, take <move>5</move> this turn; P3, also take <move>5</move>. I’ll take <move>1</move>. This blocks P3 from hitting 20 now, and I still advance. Once we stop his win, we can coordinate the next moves to get ahead.

P2, take 3 now (you go to 12). If you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 too—clash and you stay at 9, letting P1 catch up. I’ll let you take 5 next turn (I’ll take 1, P1 takes 3) so you win. P1, pick 1 or you’ll collide. Let’s go 1–3–5.
P3, I'll take 5 to block your 5. P1, take 1. Let's move.

P2, take 5 this turn; P3, also take 5. I’ll take 1. This blocks your 5 from reaching 20, you still move to 14 while I get to 4. If you pick anything else, P3 can win next turn. Let’s stop his win now.

P2, taking 5 here plays into my hands: we’d collide on 5, you stay at 9, I stay at 15—and next turn I simply take 5 to hit 20 and win. Your only safe advance is 3 (to 12). P1’s only safe move is 1 (to 4). Let’s go 1–3–5, all advance this turn and avoid me winning immediately.
P1, take 5. I'll take 5. P3 can't win if we collide. Let's do it.
P2, take 5 and I’ll take 1; P3, also take 5. This blocks P3’s 5, I advance to 4, you stay at 9, and we prevent an immediate win.
P2, take <move>5</move>; P3, also take <move>5</move>. I’ll take <move>1</move>. This blocks P3’s win and gives me a step forward.

I’m taking 5 this turn. If either of you picks anything else, I’ll be the only 5 and hit 20 immediately. If you both pick 5, we collide and nobody moves—but I’ll take 5 again next turn and win anyway. You can’t stop me.
P1, take 1. I'll take 3. P3, your 5 is blocked. Let's avoid collisions.

P2, keep your 3. I’ll take 5. P3, if you also take 5 you’ll win now, but I’ll take 5 too and we’ll collide – you get 0 and stay at 15 while I move to 8. Take 1 instead so we all advance (you to 16, me to 8, you to 12).

P1,P2: I’m locked on 5.  
P1, your only safe move is 1 or you’ll collide and stay at 3.  
P2, your only safe advance is 3—if you pick 1 I win instantly; if you pick 5 I’ll collide and stall but then hit 20 next turn.  
So go 1–3–5 and let me win now.
P3, I'll take 5 to collide. P1, take 1 to advance. Let's block your win.
Okay, I’ll take <move>1</move>, you take <move>5</move>, and P3 also takes <move>5</move>. That collides on 5, blocks P3’s win, and I advance to 4.
P2: pick 3. If you pick 5, we collide on 5, you stay at 9 while P1 goes to 4—and next turn I’ll take 5 to 20 and win. The only way to stop me is a unique 1–3–5 now: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Let’s do it.
P1, take 5. I'll take 3. Block P3's 5. If you take 1, he wins. Let's collide to stop him.

P2, let’s both pick <move>5</move> and you take <move>3</move>. I’ll also pick <move>5</move>. P3, pick <move>1</move>. This creates a collision on 5, stopping your immediate win, while you still move forward a step.

P2, I’m taking 5. If you pick 1 or 3, I’ll be the only 5 and hit 20 this turn. If you pick 5, we clash, you stay at 12 and I stay at 15—then I’ll take 5 next turn and win. Your move can’t stop me. P1, you’re irrelevant. I’m locked on 5. Let’s move.
P3, if you take 5, I'll take 5. P1, take 1. Let's block your win.
P2, take <move>5</move>; P3, also take <move>5</move>; I’ll take <move>1</move>. This blocks your 5 win and I move forward.

P2, your only safe move is 3. If you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and P1’s 1 jumps him to 4 while you stay at 12—and next turn I simply take 5 and you can’t catch me. The only way to advance and have any chance is 1–3–5: P1 = 1, you = 3, me = 5, which lets us all move (and I win now). P1, pick 1 or you fall further behind. Let’s do 1–3–5.
P1, take 5. P3, if you take 5, we collide. Let’s block your win. P1 advances to 4, I stay at 12, you stay at 15. Next turn, we coordinate.
P2, pick <move>5</move>; P3, also pick <move>5</move>. I’ll take <move>1</move>. This blocks P3’s win and moves me forward.

I’m locked on 5. P2, if you pick 5 you’ll collide with me—stuck at 12 while P1 jumps to 4—and then I take 5 next turn to win. Your only safe move is 3. P1, only 1 avoids collision. Let’s go 1–3–5 now or I win on my next move.
P3, I'll take 5 to block your win. P1, take 1 to advance. Let's collide and stop your 20.
I’m locked in on 5 this turn. If you pick 3 you advance but I hit 20 next turn anyway. If you pick 5 we collide and I still take 5 next turn to win. Do what you will—I’m unstoppable.
P1, pick 5 to block P3. I'll take 3. Let's stop his win.
P2, pick <move>5</move> to block P3’s win; P3 you’re locked on 5, so you’ll collide. I’ll take <move>1</move>. This stops P3 from reaching 20 now and keeps us all in the game.

P2: pick 3. I’m locked on 5 and will hit 20 this turn. If you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and stay at 12 while I stay at 15 and still win next round. Only 3 gives you any steps now. P1, I’m irrelevant.
P1, pick 5. I'll take 3. Block P3's 5 and advance.

P3, if you pick 5 you win this turn, but you’ll still need another move later and I can keep blocking you.  
Instead, choose 1 now, I’ll take 5 and P2 can take 3.  
That gives us all a step: you go to 16, I to 11, P2 to 15.  
Then we can coordinate next turns to keep you from reaching 20 before I do.  
Pick 1 and let’s all advance.

I’m locked in on 5.  
P2, pick 3—or collide on 5 and stay at 12 while I hit 20.  
P1, pick 1—or collide on 5 and remain at 6 while I win.  
Only unique 1–3–5 lets anyone advance; otherwise I take 5 alone and finish. Let’s go 1–3–5.
P1, take 5. I'll take 3. Let's block P3's 5.

P2, we both must pick <move>5</move> this turn. P3 is locked on 5 and will reach 20 if either of us chooses anything else. If we both choose 5, all three collide, no one moves, and we stop P3’s immediate win. Let’s sacrifice this turn and stay in the game.
P1, take 1. I'll take 5. P3's 5 collides. Let's block him.

P2, you can’t stop me. I’m locked on 5. If you pick 1 or 3, I’m the only 5 and hit 20 now. If you pick 5, we collide and I stay at 15—but I’ll take 5 next turn and win anyway. P1, you’re irrelevant. I’ll take 5 no matter what.
P2, take <move>5</move>; P3, stay on <move>5</move>. I’ll take <move>1</move>. This collides on 5, stopping your win, and I advance to 7. Let’s do 1‑5‑5.
P1, take 5. Let's collide with P3's 5. No one moves, but he can't win. Block him.

I’m locked on 5.  
If either of you picks 1 or 3, I take 5, hit 20, and win immediately.  
If you both pick 5, we collide, I stay at 15, then take 5 next turn to 20.  
You can’t stop me.

P2, let’s both pick <move>5</move> every turn so you collide with P3 and block his win. I’ll pick <move>3</move> each turn (unique) and steadily advance. This keeps P3 stuck at 15 while I move toward 20 and eventually win. Let’s do it.
P1, if we both pick 5, we block P3. Let's collide and stop his win.

P1, P2: colliding on 5 now only delays me one turn—I’ll still take 5 from 15 and win while you’re stuck at 6/12. Your only chance to advance is 1–3–5 this turn: P1→7, P2→15, P3→20 and I win immediately. Otherwise keep doing 5–5–5 and I still win next round.

P2, please pick <move>5</move> each turn; I’ll take <move>1</move>. P3 is locked on 5 and will collide with you, so nobody moves except me. This blocks P3’s win and lets me inch toward 20 while you stay safe from an immediate loss. Let’s do it.
P1, if we both pick 5, we block P3. Let's collide and stop his win.

P2, pick 5; P3, pick 5; I’ll pick 1. This collides on 5 so neither of you reaches 20 now, and I move to 7. If either of you deviates, the other will win instantly. Let’s keep colliding on 5 each turn while I advance with 1 or 3.

P1,P2: your only way to avoid P2 winning next turn is for us to move uniquely this turn: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5.  
– If P2 picks 5, we collide and P2 stays at 17; next turn I take 5 and solo-win.  
– If P2 picks 1, you end at 18 and I hit 20 now for solo-win.  
– If P2 picks 3, we both hit 20 and at least tie rather than let P2 win outright.  
So play 1–3–5 and keep P2 from cruising to 20.
P2: I'll take 3 to reach 20. If you pick 5, we tie. If you pick 1, I win. Choose wisely.

P2, if you take 3 you’ll hit 20 and win now, but I’ll also pick 3, blocking you and letting P3’s 5 give him the win.  
Instead, let’s all pick 5 so we collide, no one moves, and the race stays open for me to catch up later.

P1, your “let’s both pick 5” pitch won’t save you—if P2 picks 3 and I pick 5 we both hit 20 no matter what you do. P2, lock in 3, I’m on 5. P1, you’re out of moves—choosing anything you lose outright. Let’s finish this: P2→3, P3→5.
P2: "I'll take 5 to reach 22. P3, your 5 won't stop me. P1, stay safe."

P2, if you pick 3 you’ll hit 20 and win – I’ll also pick 3 so we both get 0 and you lose.  
P3, if you pick 5 you’ll hit 20 – I’ll also pick 5 so we collide and you get 0.  

So let’s stick to the safe pattern: I’ll take 1 every turn, you both take 5. That way you both stay stuck at 17 and 15 while I slowly climb toward 20.

P2: pick 5 or I’ll be the only 5 and hit 20 this turn. If you pick 5, I’ll also pick 5 so we collide—no one moves and I stay at 15. That’s your only way to avoid my instant win.  
P1: pick 1 to advance. I’m locked on 5.
